Visualization module¶

Arthur Zwaenepoel - 2017

wgd.viz.plot_selection(dists, output_file=None, alphas=None, colors=None, labels=None, ks_range=(0.1, 5), offset=5, title='Species genus', **kwargs)¶

Plot a panel from the all.csv output from the Ks analysis.

Parameters:
  • dists – distribution(s), if multiple provide as list
  • alphas – alpha values for the different distributions (will assign automatically if not provided)
  • ks_range – Ks range to include for plotting
  • offset – offset of axis
  • title – panel title
  • kwargs – keyword arguments for matplotlib.pyplot.hist()
Returns:

matplotlib.pyplot.Figure object
wgd.viz.syntenic_dotplot(df, output_file=None)¶

Syntenic dotplot function

Parameters:
  • df – multiplicons pandas data frame
  • output_file – output file name
Returns:

figure
wgd.viz.syntenic_dotplot_ks_colored(df, an, ks, color_map='Spectral', output_file=None)¶

Syntenic dotplot with segment colored by mean Ks value

Parameters:
  • df – multiplicons pandas data frame
  • an – anchorpoints pandas data frame
  • ks – Ks distribution data frame
  • color_map – color map string
  • output_file – output file name
Returns:

figure
